text: Hi, welcome to howtocookthat.net.

I'm Ann Reardon and this is Part 3 of the
Fondant Review comparing 8 different types
of Fondant.

For our next test we are going to cut a 5cm
thick strip of our Fondant.

Then we are going to drape it over a piece
of cake covered in butter cream.

Then we'll leave them there so that we can
compare what they look like, if there's any
difference between them.

I'll show you shots of these Fondants in a
few different lights.

Basically any of them will cover a cake and
will be fine for different purposes.

If you are doing a kid's birthday cake or
that sort of a thing any of them will do.

A few of them are smoother and just look that
bit more perfect than others.

So the plainer the cake that you are doing
the more important that it looks perfect.

So if it's something like a plain white wedding
cake you might want to spend that little bit

more extra getting Fondants that are that
bit better quality and just look smooth and
beautiful on.

So have a look through the pictures yourself
I've tried to get them in that specific light
so that you can see the difference.

Don't forget to subscribe, leave some comments
and click like.

To see the full results of the review watch
the other videos and go to the blogs howtocookthat.net.

Theres a link in the description below the
video.
